website_summaries.verdict: A super fast sifter option for people who bake a lot or have problems turning a crank on other sifters.
pros: Made from a BPA-free material with a stainless steel mesh screen for sifting
Screen is easy to remove for cleaning
cons: There is a gap between the cup and the screen, which sometimes allows flour to go through the device without getting sifted

customer_reviews.title: HOLY DOUGH BALLS, YOU HAVE TO BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest invention since toilet paper. I didn't even know I really needed this until I plugged that sucker in and flipped the switch and TAA DAA! no mess, perfectly sifted flour at my finger tips. I will no longer skip that baking step of "sift the dry ingredients together." this is now my go to wedding gift for all of my closest mates. If you are looking at this thinking, how hard is it to just use my regular old mesh shift that my great great granny gave me, well throw it in the goodwill box and prime this thing to your door. I will change your life.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, especially if you have hand/wrist problems
customer_reviews.text: I just received this so I can’t speak to sturdiness over time. But I can say I’m very happy with this sifter. I have golfer’s elbow, which come from overuse of my wrist and is very painful. Squeezing the handle of a manual sifter hurts, so this is a godsend. See video for how fast and well it works. I can see that it takes attention to clean, you don’t just rinse it, you have to get into the nooks and crannies. But again, this is a great tool for anyone, but especially people with hand or wrist problems.
customer_reviews.author: Efromthebronx

customer_reviews.title: Who makes a flour sifter that you cannot wash!
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I purchased a replacement to for my original battery operated sifter that I had for 15years and the quality is Poor. In my old one I could sift 4 C flour no issue. With this new one, 1 C was a hassle. Worse, the wires are exposed under the sifter once you take off the removable screen. I sifted my spices and flour together and now there is flour and spice in the crevices by the wires. The entire bowl should be washable! Not just a flimsy Screen. Either purchase as a 1time use item or hunt for a better one elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only one speed.
customer_reviews.text: This shifter saves labor but has no way to adjust the speed. It's fairly large and must place a plate or mat under the shifter or whatever you are shifting goes all over the place. It actually requires more clean up effort if you only want to shift a little amount. There is no way to adjust the speed and fine mist of powder all over the place. Nonetheless, it's a major labor saving tool if you are sifting a large quantity.
customer_reviews.author: gartail

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job but I have 2 issues.
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job but I have 2 issues. 1) It's made so that the screen unscrews from the bottom for cleaning but trying to get flour out of the crevices while cleaning can be difficult. 2) Also found that installing the battery can be tricky as the spring forces the battery back up sometimes not allowing the cover to stay in place. I've been a mechanic for over 50 years so installing a battery shouldn't be that difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: This battery operated sifter is the perfect “tool” for macaron making. Re-ordered after it broke, using it 3X. The screen rotated off for washing twice - third time the whole battery housing unscrewed with screen rendering unit “dead.”
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewin

customer_reviews.title: Flour sifter looked a LOT like wireless speakers and wouldn't sift any flour.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this battery powered sifter because my squeeze sifter isn't "cutting the mustard". After online research I decided on this model (the field of options is admittedly very small). Imagine my surprise to open my sifter only to discover 2 knockoff china bluetooth speakers! I tried EVERYTHING I could think of to get these to sift flour...just wasn't happening. Returned and MIGHT reorder....pretty salty at present.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sifter!!!
customer_reviews.text: My older mechanical sifter fell apart, after shopping for new one I decided to give a shot to this one. And - I am not sorry at all. When I received this one, I thought for myself that sifting area is too small. But the sifter was big surprise! When cooking I put into it 1/2 kg (little more then 2 ponds) of flour, pushed the button and before i knew, sifting was done, no any clogging or additional shaking with sifter. Wow! Very impressing!
customer_reviews.author: M. E.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and saves time.
customer_reviews.text: How did I cook for 60 years without this gadget! I bake a lot and have always sifted my flour- plus sifted salt, baking powder, baking soda, etc. in with my flour to incorporate the dry ingredients.. I kept buying metal sifters that always rust or the screen gets all bent out of shape. YOU CANNOT BELIEVE how much easier sifting ingredients can be now. It makes baking so much easier. It is battery operated and very lightweight. I recommend that every baker should have one
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Nifty!
customer_reviews.text: Why oh why didn't I buy one of these sooner and save myself time and a serious hand cramp? Works great for sifting large amounts of flour or powdered sugar, easy to rinse out. My only complaints are that it doesn't have anything to hold it on the edge of the bowl, so you can't dump your stuff in and walk away to do something else, and that it is LOUD. If you are making things like royal icing that need a lot of sifting, it's a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Surfbored

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This did not sift. Makes alot of noise and clumps flour and bits of dust came out. Hand was sore from my feeble attempts for little to nothing to come out. I tried for 45 minutes and got a couple of tablespoons out. Finally dumped it in trash and went and bought cake flour to make pound cakes. I have a disability (stroke) and really needed this to work using one hand. Huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Hand Surgery
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on both hands so I slowed down with my baking because I couldn't do a lot of manual sifting. Then I discovered this wonderful little gadget. It's quick and easy to use and my friends and family are so grateful. The only problem I experienced was trying to get all of the confectioner's sugar off of it. It seems to stick and since you can't submerge it, it takes a little time to clean.
customer_reviews.author: mspctech2000

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: Genius invention. I was so tired of sifting everything by hand. I have a home baking biz so I sift a heckuva lot of stuff ahead of time so it's ready when I need it. This thing is a time saver. VERY easy to clean even without a dishwasher. It was a little part that you can unscrew on the bottom to give a good hot water rinse & you're done. I'm going to buy a 2nd one in case mine gets worn out from so much use!!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi T.

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: This thing sifts like an industrial sander. It is quick and easy and blows through flour in short order. I bought if for my wife, but whenever she is baking I volunteer to sift the flour because I enjoy using it so much. My sister-in-law asked for a had powered sifter for Christmas, but I bought her one of these instead and she loves it. It has a simple one button, on-off operation. On = flour flowing through like water. It's a great kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.author: Buys too much stuff from Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was extremely slow, took longer than the squeeze handle one I had before. The sifting hole is really small. It was as loud as a cheap vibrator. I am returning it because the above reasons. It would make baking long term miserable. And I found one at tj maxx for 6$ with a wide mouth and rotating handle that works super fast and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth russell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool, not a fine mesh
customer_reviews.text: It really does make sifting a breeze. A much hated chore that I often ignore in recipes is now a snap. The mesh is a medium to somewhat large weave. I grind my own flour for some things so I was hoping to be able to sift bran out but it doesn’t work for that
customer_reviews.author: RJJ

customer_reviews.title: It's battery operated
customer_reviews.text: What I like about it is I don't need to use a crank to shift anymore. Lmao my husband says we have one that one u just got don't even have a crank to shift he goes our old one is better. I put the battery in n turned it on he goes oh damn. hehehe.. Ty Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Whetzele

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I make single servings of keto bread daily so this makes it so much easier to sift. I wish it was waterproof, but its still pretty easy to clean. I carefully rinse off the top and then wipe the underside with a damp paper towel and it gets 90 percent of the almond meal off of it. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Person

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item
customer_reviews.text: I need to repack a different powder. When it is humid this powder tends to clump like scoopable cat litter. A manual squeeze and spin sifter would have given me carpel tunnel syndrome. I expected the arms to spin around. All it does is vibrate in the middle. Turns out that is exactly what is needed. I can sift a kilo of powder in under a minute. So much faster than i was expecting. One of the most useful products I have gotten from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: C. R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and a big help
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this because I have severe carpal tunnel and a manual sifter was just too painful. It works really well and holds a good amount. I have sifted 6 cups of powdered sugar with no problem. You can also sift flour with other spices, cocoa powder, etc. added. It is so easy to clean and dries really quick. I wish I had bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Cacummings

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this one!
customer_reviews.text: So far this sifter is a gem. I've only used it a couple of times, but it is FAST and easy. It's nice and wide so it's easy to pour your powdered sugar or flour in. It easily holds a couple of cups at a time and if you can hold it in one hand and scoop with the other, you could just keep adding until you have enough. Would love to see some kind of attachment so that it can clip to the edge of a bowl or something.
customer_reviews.author: writeZoe

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid this will a fragile product, but it is not it is actually very sturdy. Work great recommend to everyone who need to sift almond flour or coconut flour.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic

Fantastic. Replaced a squeeze type that fell apart after 3 months (12 uses). Questions asked about cleaning, as I clean any new cooking item before use, I easily removed screen (per instructions) and washed it. Instructions say not to get body wet (risk of shorting the electrical connections) so I wipped it down with a sanitary wipe.
customer_reviews.author: L. Deadwler

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is poorly designed I can’t believe it made it to market. The only thing this is good for is sifting no more then 1/2 cup of flour. After that the weight of the dry food to be sifted is so weighty that the bottom screen falls off. Yes. Pouring the entire contents into the bowl. I used this once and threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk.  Worked for 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. It worked for 30 seconds and stopped. I changed out to three different NEW batteries and it did nothing. Sadly, I didn't use it for a few weeks after buying it, so the return window is closed. My mistake. Do not buy. I was so excited to use it bc I have arthritis in my hands...very disappointing. BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best.
customer_reviews.text: Only useful for sugar. Flour and brown sugar clogs it up. Wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: B-TX

customer_reviews.title: WISH I HAD THIS  YEARS AGO!
customer_reviews.text: I always hated having to sift flour or powdered sugar. It made a big mess and hurt my hand. As I have developed carpal tunnel syndrome, it was becoming more and more difficult to squeeze the handle of the old fashioned sifter. I thought there must be a better way to do this. Voila, I turned to Amazon and found the battery powered sifter and ordered it immediately. It operates so smoothly and quietly. I do a lot of baking and this item has definitely made my life much easier and faster and with less clean up! Wouldn't part with it now!
customer_reviews.author: carol fritz

customer_reviews.title: Best electric sifter ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a couple of sifters over the last 40 years, both manual and battery powered. This one that runs with just a battery is excellent ! It runs so smoothly. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: flower fan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fast :-D
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget actually works!!! One handed operation and holds roughly 650 grams of flour, which it processes remarkably quickly.....Push a switch and you are off and running. The sifting screen unscrews easily for quick clean up.....I am impressed!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael's Custom Shutters

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a lark. Taking it out of the box I had my doubts. Surprise, it works great. Almost two dozen uses, in less than two weeks, and it has yet to fail. Sifts better than my manual one. So far the only thing that I do not like is that it uses a C size battery.
customer_reviews.author: Wulf

customer_reviews.title: Best sifter I ever found
customer_reviews.text: Where were you all my life? Not till I was in my late 50s did I find this sifter - and I am so happy I did. I don't sift often, but when I do, this makes super fast, easy work of it. Worth having in the cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: HapiOver40

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy, breezy, Flour Sifter
customer_reviews.text: Everyone rolls their eyes at an automatic sifter. "Aren't hand cranks good enough?" they whine. Probably, if you want to take forever and end up tapping it against your hand. This worked thoroughly and quickly, though a C battery is funny. And, like the manual, if it stops working, just tap it on your hand to sift.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: the batter cover came off a couple times to have towatch to see if it still does
customer_reviews.text: So far this works well, the batter cover came off a couple times to have to watch to see if it still does. Only used it to sift flour mixed with Hi-Maize Resistant Starch, bakewell and baking soda does a fast job of it. The manufacture should make a cover for it you place on the bottom as you are filling it up keep it from falling through onto the table. I used a small plate just another thing to wash. They should seal or make the motor water proof so you can rinse out the upper part
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my husband was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Husband is old fashioned and sifts the flour. He had a sifter exactly like this one and after 40 years, it broke!!! He was super happy to find an identical one! Here's to another 40 years of sifting flour!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Battery Operated Flour Sifter
customer_reviews.text: Saved you time & trouble when making pastries & breads. I'm so happy I found this because the regular sifter took up so much time. This is quick & easy like having extra hands helping you get things done.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, just has problems.
customer_reviews.text: First off it would not stay on unless you kept turning it on & off. Secondly it has some type of problem with the battery. After I turned it off & left it sit I went to clean it & the battery was so hot I couldn't hold it. I tried another barrery, same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Gallops

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with it because you can’t wash it like normal. Just decided it wasn’t for me and it didn’t work well either when I tried using it. Not much power....
customer_reviews.author: ROBYN S.

customer_reviews.title: It is great for older people who have trouble with their hands/wrists
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my mom awhile back and then she moved. The movers lost this item. This sifter is what she wanted for Christmas, so I got her another one. It is great for older people who have trouble with their hands/wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Speechville

customer_reviews.title: A flick of the switch and this utensil does the work for you.
customer_reviews.text: This "utensil" for the kitchen is excellent. It will hold four or more cups of flour, runs smoothly on a battery and is excellent in all ways. Any cook would be pleased to received it as a gift. I have purchased several of them and gave them as gifts to special friends.
customer_reviews.author: Charmayne S. Dierker

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I have shoulder issues and it's hard to stand the and shift flour by hand. This makes our so easy. You do have to stir the mix before sitting for proper disbursement. Takes less than 30 seconds to shift.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie w

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not look like this. This is most likely the new model
customer_reviews.text: Mine did not look like this. This is most likely the new model. I must of received left over stock. I have purchase 4 of the older model that is how well I like this battery operated sifter. I gave them as gifts. I use mine most every day. Anything that has flour and dry ingredients I sift. The bake goods come out so much better. I do have to say the wire screen is coming out of mine quite a bit now so I will purchase another. It has most likely the equivalent of an automobile with 200,000 miles on it. So it is time to trade for a new one. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Champlin

customer_reviews.title: Nice strong motor - bought 3
customer_reviews.text: This is my second battery powered sifter. My first one was another brand that was probably 10 years old; it finally give up the ghost. Searching on line for a new one and felt this was a good choice - so I bought three. One for my daughter and one for my daughter-in-law and one for me. (If one is good, buy 3 ;-) Nice strong motor for my baking needs. Bottom screen removes so that it can be rinsed off. I gave it 4 stars because the rest of the unit is a little hard to clean, especially after sifting cocoa. This sure beats hand sifting and have been enjoying this addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: sewgrand

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This works and is a time saver. However my older model uses a AA battery and this one uses a C battery. Unfortunately the difference in weight is enough to bother my arthritic hand. But it is still better than having to turn the handle on my manual sifter. I keep one of these for flour and one for powder sugar. They don't do well on really lumpy sugar or flour. I dump the lumps into a container and when I have a lot I put them through a sieve. My manual sifter doesn't do that much better than this one with hard lumps.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I just started milling my own flour. When I made the first batch, it took forever to sift it into bags. We had a hand-squeeze sifter and it took nearly 10 minutes to sift two cups of flour. Not to mention how badly our hands began cramping by the end. Immediately went to Amazon and found the Norpro Sifter. It runs on 1 C battery (not included but clearly stated so we had one ready). We put 2 cups of flour in the Norpro and hit the switch and the entire contents were sifted in 10 seconds. The Norpro sifter is easy to use, easy to clean and inexpensive. We couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.text: What a great sifter. I will never use a regular hand sifter again. It did a great job on my flour and powdered sugar. My arthritic hands say thank you.
customer_reviews.author: murph

customer_reviews.title: I’m never going back!
customer_reviews.text: I make cookies on a large scale and this really cuts down the time I spend sifting ingredients together! Would recommend!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, not to clean

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!

Only thing wrong I've found so far is that the bottom piece is supposed to twist off for cleaning, and I haven't been able to remove it. It's on so tight that I think I will break the unit before it comes off. Other than that it's fine.

customer_reviews.title: A great sifter to own
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease and control, it cuts sifting time in half. Just be very careful with cleaning this product, you don't want to get certain parts of it wet. But all in all great to have in your kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far so good...good for ppl like me with arthritis
customer_reviews.author: thornyyrose

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically to sift flour for my angel food cake and it works wonderfully for that and that is why I gave it 5 stars for ease of use and what my needs are!
customer_reviews.author: Ramona

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but didn’t stand the test of time
customer_reviews.text: I loved this sifter at first; however, it did not work for very long. Because the motor cannot get wet, cleaning is not very effective. I love the idea of a battery-powered sifter; however, this one did not stand up to the test. I have had it for less than eight weeks, and it no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Great sifter!
customer_reviews.text: I used this sifter for the first time today and absolutely loved it. It was so much more convenient than the hand-crank variety. I put in two cups of flour and it was nicely sifted within 5 seconds. I was surprised at the amount of power provided by one AA battery; it was more than sufficient. The sifter may be loud, but it is only for a few seconds, so it's not a big deal. The handle is removeable and fits inside the sifter, so it stores easily. I make my own bread and pasta, and I forsee this sifter becoming one of my important baking tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jinjer

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: Great if you will use occasionally for flour or cocoa. If you want to use for confectioner's sugar, this is not it. Super slow and hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F

customer_reviews.title: Amazing battery operated flour sifter.
customer_reviews.text: I love this battery operated sifter. People laugh at me when I tell them about it but itWORKS and it does a marvellous job and quickly. It is especially good for sifting ground almonds when making French macarons. It is fast and the battery lasts for ages and the price is really good too. I have not been able to find one at any of the shops so thankyou for carrying it. I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Joanzy

customer_reviews.title: The holes are so large, it does not sift the flour!
customer_reviews.text: The holes in the sifter are so large, that all the flour simply goes through. Im surprised this has such high reviews. Either mine is defective ? or others don't realize that it's not actually sifting their flour ?.
customer_reviews.author: YZ W.

customer_reviews.title: It makes making macrons so much simpler. My wrist ...
customer_reviews.text: It makes making macrons so much simpler. My wrist never gets tired from working a sifter. Slightly difficult to clean. Wash with caution, this is my second one due to the fact that some water got into the inner mechanism and my first one quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and thought it would be the answer to my prayers because I have arthritis in my hands. It is sub-par at best. the flour trickles out of the sifter which takes forever. I would not recommend this to anyone unless you have all day to watch flour trickle through a sifter. This product really sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Vera Taylor-Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you want to use it once or 3 times
customer_reviews.text: After you clean this product about 3 times then it goes to trash. it stopped working for me even after replacing with new batteries
customer_reviews.author: Contina V. Benn

customer_reviews.title: Best sifter ever

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritic hands, so squeezing a hand sifter is painful. This fits the bill for me perfectly! It's a little slow going, so anyone with capable hands might want to stick with a manual sifter. Don't overfill - it bogs down. I also cut a hole in a piece of cardboard to fit over a bowl so I don't have to hold the sifter - frees up my hands to keep working.
